channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report X-2024071467
item.description:
Report X-2024071467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon opening truck for unloading there was a strong odor. Began to unload packages and noticed package on the bottom of a stack of packages was wet. There were no other packages that were wet only the one containing UN1090. Removed package from truck and placed in a HAZMAT drum. Inspected other packages and determined that the spill was isolated to the one package and no other packages were wet.

item.title: Report X-2024071249
item.description:
Report X-2024071249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered to have been wet during unload. It was loaded in a way that ignored the orientation arrows printed on the side of the package. I tested the pH and found it to be around 12. Upon inspection I found the cap was loose on one of the inner jugs causing it to leak. I secured the package in a lined HazMat tote and placed it in the HWSA.
